Ingredients: 

For the Dumpling Filling: 

• 1/2 pound ground pork or ground chicken (or use tofu for a vegetarian option) 
• 1 cup finely chopped Napa cabbage 
• 2 green onions, finely chopped 
• 2 cloves garlic, minced 
• 1-inch piece of fresh ginger, grated 
• 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
• 1 tablespoon sesame oil 
• 1/2 teaspoon sugar 
• Salt and pepper to taste 

For the Dumpling Wrappers: 

• 1 package of round dumpling wrappers (about 30-40 wrappers) 
• Water for sealing 

For Cooking the Dumplings: 

• 2-3 tablespoons vegetable oil 
• 1/2 cup water 

Procedure: 

1. Prepare the Filling: 

• In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground meat (or tofu), finely chopped Napa cabbage, green onions, garlic, and grated ginger. 
• Add soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, salt, and pepper to the mixture. 
• Mix everything well to combine. The filling is now ready. 

2. Assemble the Dumplings: 

• Take a dumpling wrapper and place about a teaspoon of filling in the center. 
• Dip your finger in water and moisten the edge of the wrapper. 
• Fold the wrapper in half, creating a half-moon shape. 
• Press the edges together to seal the dumpling, ensuring there are no openings. 

3. Cook the Dumplings: 

• Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. 
• Add 2-3 tablespoons of vegetable oil to the skillet. 
• Place the dumplings in a single layer in the skillet. Make sure they're not touching each other. 
• Cook for about 2-3 minutes or until the bottoms turn golden brown. 
• Add 1/2 cup of water to the skillet, quickly cover with a lid, and reduce the heat to low. 
• Steam the dumplings for 7-8 minutes, or until the water has evaporated. 

4. Serve: 

• Carefully remove the dumplings from the skillet once they are cooked. They should be crispy on the bottom and soft on top. 
• Serve the dumplings hot with soy sauce, rice vinegar, or your favorite dipping sauce. 


You can customize the filling to suit your tastes by adding other ingredients like shrimp, mushrooms, or water chestnuts. Enjoy your homemade dumplings!
